bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 219 (Monday, December 20, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. LESKO:H.R. 6333.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8 of the U.S. Constitution[Page H7838]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

summary.text: This bill prohibits the use of federal funds to establish or maintain a national database that identifies individuals based on whether they have or have not received any vaccine.

bill.title: To prohibit the use of Federal funds to establish, maintain, or support any national database identifying individuals as having received or not received any vaccine.

item.title: To prohibit the use of Federal funds to establish, maintain, or support any national database identifying individuals as having received or not received any vaccine.
To prohibit the use of Federal funds to establish, maintain, or support any national database identifying individuals as having received or not received any vaccine.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
